content: the first stitch of the row again figure b row 30-31 flipper 1 single_crochet around 8 row 32 flipper 1 decrease single_crochet decrease single_crochet decrease 5 cut yarn leave a long tail insert your hook in the stitch that would have been the 9th single_crochet of row 29 had you not skipped that half pick up a new tail of yarn and pull through figure c row 29 flipper 2 single_crochet around row 30-31 flipper 2 single_crochet around 8 row 32 flipper 2 decrease single_crochet decrease single_crochet decrease 5 figure d cut yarn leave a long tail and sew remaining stitches closed with a tapestry needle on both sides finish off the brown string is my stitch marker front flippers make 2 leave a long tail before you start your chain chain 8 slip_stitch in furthest chain from hook to form ring row 1-2 single_crochet around 8 row 3-4 2sc single_crochet single_crochet decrease single_crochet 3 times 8 row 5-end 2sc single_crochet decrease 5 times 4 cut yarn leave a long tail and sew remaining stitches closed with a tapestry needle finish off sew front flippers onto body with a tapestry needle finish off if you used fun fur you might want to give your seal a haircut © copyright 2009 by space sandsteel this work is licensed under the creative commons attribution-non commercial-no derivative works 3 0 license to view a copy of this license please visit http //creativecommons org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3 0/ for questions or comments please email the designer at sandsteeldesigns@gmail com
